articles.description: All individuals traveling to the United States will now be photographed before entering or leaving the country starting Friday, according to a new regulation from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS). articles.title: Proposed Alberta separation referendum question approved
articles.description: Elections Alberta has approved the proposed referendum question, 'Do you agree that the province of Alberta should cease to be a part of Canada to become an independent state?'

articles.title: Carney names Mark Wiseman as Canada’s new U.S. ambassador
articles.description: Mark Wiseman will take over as Canada's ambassador in Washington, D.C. on Feb. 15, 2026, Prime Minister Mark Carney’s office said in a statement.

articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

articles.title: Two killed in suspected Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
articles.description: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.
